com.backyardbrains.view
Class TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.Simple2DOnScaleGestureListener

java.lang.Object
  com.backyardbrains.view.TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.Simple2DOnScaleGestureListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener
Enclosing class:
TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector
public static class TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.Simple2DOnScaleGestureListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener

A convenience class to extend when you only want to listen for a subset of scaling-related events. This implements all methods in TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener but does nothing. OnScaleGestureListener#onScale(ScaleGestureDetector) returns false so that a subclass can retrieve the accumulated scale factor in an overridden onScaleEnd. OnScaleGestureListener#onScaleBegin(ScaleGestureDetector) returns true.

Method Detail

onScale

public boolean onScale(TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector detector)
Description copied from interface: TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener
Responds to scaling events for a gesture in progress. Reported by pointer motion.

Specified by:
onScale in interface TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener
Parameters:
detector - The detector reporting the event - use this to retrieve extended info about event state.
Returns:
Whether or not the detector should consider this event as handled. If an event was not handled, the detector will continue to accumulate movement until an event is handled. This can be useful if an application, for example, only wants to update scaling factors if the change is greater than 0.01.

onScaleBegin

public boolean onScaleBegin(TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector detector)
Description copied from interface: TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener
Responds to the beginning of a scaling gesture. Reported by new pointers going down.

Specified by:
onScaleBegin in interface TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener
Parameters:
detector - The detector reporting the event - use this to retrieve extended info about event state.
Returns:
Whether or not the detector should continue recognizing this gesture. For example, if a gesture is beginning with a focal point outside of a region where it makes sense, onScaleBegin() may return false to ignore the rest of the gesture.

onScaleEnd

public void onScaleEnd(TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector detector)
Description copied from interface: TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener
Responds to the end of a scale gesture. Reported by existing pointers going up. Once a scale has ended, ScaleGestureDetector#getFocusX() and ScaleGestureDetector#getFocusY() will return the location of the pointer remaining on the screen.

Specified by:
onScaleEnd in interface TwoDimensionScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener
Parameters:
detector - The detector reporting the event - use this to retrieve extended info about event state.
